Our international operations are growing stronger throughout the Americas and expanding from our headquarters in Mexico City. So, we are looking to increase our pre-sales team in order to take a qualitative leap in technical and product terms for our ongoing international expansion plans.

Your main challenge will consist of research and technical analysis for our SaaS services (present and future), as well as for our client projects. The pre-sales department is the technical reference within the commercial area and thus provides technical consultancy/guidance to all national and international projects in which Edicom takes part. This is where you will be a key player from a technical standpoint in the development of company business.

You will manage the entire technical sales process: from the analysis of new solutions and/or B2B projects, to the presentation and technical advocacy of these solutions/projects.

How to overcome this challenge?

Your first step with us will be a 3-month specialized training course through which you will learn about the technologies, tools and functionalities of our EDI, e-invoicing and tax compliance solutions (VAT Compliance, Reporting, etc.).

This training is provided from a technical viewpoint without losing sight of the commercial side.

Once you have passed this course, depending on the foreign languages you master, you will be able to develop an international region, assuming it through research and documentation in order to become a specialist and provide the best integration solutions.

Task

You will work on the basis of tasks scheduled in a timely manner, in order to manage projects in the most efficient and controlled way possible.

You will be in constant communication and interaction with departments such as Sales, Project Management and R+D+i.

Your own functions can be divided into 3 areas of action:

SaaS
You will be researching and reviewing updates from international regulatory agencies, looking for changes in technical requirements, tax information reporting and passing on these requirements to the Development area.
Analysing and segmenting the different projects from the technical perspective, according to our software portfolio: e-Invoicing, EDI services, Trust services, etc.
Referring to Project Management and R+D+i the technical analyses necessary to adapt the platform functionality to comply with regulatory requirements.
Maintaining the demos so that they are updated and for the ongoing enhancement of our presentation.
You will enjoy a constant process of documentation and research, in order to determine the evolution and modifications of our SaaS, as well as international compliance legislation.
Alongside the sales and marketing department, defining and participating in the technical content of webinars, papers, white papers, presentations, etc.
Client
Leader in driving and actively consulting on the technology evaluation stage of the sales process, working in conjunction with the sales team as a key technical advisor and promoting our products and services.
You will take part in technical business meetings through conferences or face-to-face support previously defined by the commercial department to set out the technical needs of the business and provide optimal solutions.
You will be drafting RFIs, RFPs, RFQs, tenders and PoC (proofs of concept), negotiating contracts from the technical side, MSAs, SOWs and closing agreements with them.
You will give presentations to the client of the technical proposals describing the client‚Äôs needs and integration project.
Providing responses to security questionnaires (Risk Assessment and meetings with InfoSec departments of major accounts).
Validating and checking that the documented technical project is in line with the integration model required by the client.
Training
You will take part in the design, development and management of international product and service training plans for all of our business development sites.

Requirements

What we look for in you:

Engineer with vocation and interest in the IT sector. Previous IT experience appreciated, but also candidates seeking a change and with a strong commitment to this sector.
Previous experience in pre-sales teams as Project Manager or Product Owner is a plus.
High level of English, essential for day-to-day work. A second foreign language such as Portuguese, will be highly appreciated.
You will be a multidisciplinary person, with a certain commercial vocation, but not wishing to distance yourself from the more technical side.
Good informative skills.
Good ability to work in a team, to be able to collaborate with the commercial and technical areas.
Availability to travel both at home and internationally, less than 20% of the time.
